snippet: A new law to punish those who regularly visit extremist Web sites or travel to weapons-training camps abroad will now go to Parliament.
abstract: France’s conservative government unveils new counterterrorism law to punish those who regularly visit extremist Web sites or travel to weapons-training camps abroad; the move is in response to the killings in southern France in March by a French-born Muslim, Mohammed Merah, who claimed inspiration from Al Qaeda.
lead_paragraph: A new law to punish those who regularly visit extremist Web sites or travel to weapons-training camps abroad will now go to Parliament.
